00279 struct hwloc_obj_memory_s {
00280   hwloc_uint64_t total_memory; 
00281   hwloc_uint64_t local_memory; 
00283   unsigned page_types_len; 
00289   struct hwloc_obj_memory_page_type_s {

00292   } * page_types;

00299 struct hwloc_obj {
00300   /* physical information */
00301   hwloc_obj_type_t type;                
00302   unsigned os_index;                    
00303   char *name;                           
00305   struct hwloc_obj_memory_s memory;     
00307   union hwloc_obj_attr_u *attr;         
00310   /* global position */
00311   unsigned depth;                       
00312   unsigned logical_index;               
00314   signed os_level;                      
00316   /* cousins are all objects of the same type (and depth) across the entire topology */
00317   struct hwloc_obj *next_cousin;        
00318   struct hwloc_obj *prev_cousin;        
00320   /* children of the same parent are siblings, even if they may have different type and depth */
00321   struct hwloc_obj *parent;             
00322   unsigned sibling_rank;                
00323   struct hwloc_obj *next_sibling;       
00324   struct hwloc_obj *prev_sibling;       
00326   /* children array below this object */
00327   unsigned arity;                       
00328   struct hwloc_obj **children;          
00329   struct hwloc_obj *first_child;        
00330   struct hwloc_obj *last_child;         
00332   /* misc */
00333   void *userdata;                       
00335   /* cpusets and nodesets */
00336   hwloc_cpuset_t cpuset;                
00349   hwloc_cpuset_t complete_cpuset;       
00360   hwloc_cpuset_t online_cpuset;         
00368   hwloc_cpuset_t allowed_cpuset;        
00379   hwloc_nodeset_t nodeset;              
00396   hwloc_nodeset_t complete_nodeset;     
00410   hwloc_nodeset_t allowed_nodeset;      
00423   struct hwloc_distances_s **distances; 
00424   unsigned distances_count;
00425 
00426   struct hwloc_obj_info_s *infos;       
00427   unsigned infos_count;                 
00428 };
00432 typedef struct hwloc_obj * hwloc_obj_t;
00433 
00435 union hwloc_obj_attr_u {
00437   struct hwloc_cache_attr_s {
00438     hwloc_uint64_t size;                          
00439     unsigned depth;                       
00440     unsigned linesize;                    
00441     int associativity;                    
00443   } cache;
00445   struct hwloc_group_attr_s {
00446     unsigned depth;                       
00447   } group;
00449   struct hwloc_pcidev_attr_s {
00450     unsigned short domain;
00451     unsigned char bus, dev, func;
00452     unsigned short class_id;
00453     unsigned short vendor_id, device_id, subvendor_id, subdevice_id;
00454     unsigned char revision;
00455     float linkspeed; /* in GB/s */
00456   } pcidev;
00458   struct hwloc_bridge_attr_s {
00459     union {
00460       struct hwloc_pcidev_attr_s pci;
00461     } upstream;
00462     hwloc_obj_bridge_type_t upstream_type;
00463     union {
00464       struct {
00465         unsigned short domain;
00466         unsigned char secondary_bus, subordinate_bus;
00467       } pci;
00468     } downstream;
00469     hwloc_obj_bridge_type_t downstream_type;
00470     unsigned depth;
00471   } bridge;
00473   struct hwloc_osdev_attr_s {
00474     hwloc_obj_osdev_type_t type;
00475   } osdev;
00476 };
00477 
00492 struct hwloc_distances_s {
00493   unsigned relative_depth;      
00495   unsigned nbobjs;              
00500   float *latency;               
00505   float latency_max;            
00506   float latency_base;           
00510 };

00619 enum hwloc_topology_flags_e {
00620   HWLOC_TOPOLOGY_FLAG_WHOLE_SYSTEM = (1<<0),
00629   HWLOC_TOPOLOGY_FLAG_IS_THISSYSTEM = (1<<1),
00649   /* \brief Detect PCI devices.
00650    *
00651    * By default, I/O devices are ignored. This flag enables I/O device
00652    * detection using the libpci backend. Only the common PCI devices (GPUs,
00653    * NICs, block devices, ...) and host bridges (objects that connect the host
00654    * objects to an I/O subsystem) will be added to the topology.
00655    * Uncommon devices and other bridges (such as PCI-to-PCI bridges) will be
00656    * ignored.
00657    */
00658   HWLOC_TOPOLOGY_FLAG_IO_DEVICES = (1<<2),
00659 
00660   /* \brief Detect PCI bridges.
00661    *
00662    * This flag should be combined with HWLOC_TOPOLOGY_FLAG_IO_DEVICES to enable
00663    * the detection of both common devices and of all useful bridges (bridges that
00664    * have at least one device behind them).
00665    */
00666   HWLOC_TOPOLOGY_FLAG_IO_BRIDGES = (1<<3),
00667 
00668   /* \brief Detect the whole PCI hierarchy.
00669    *
00670    * This flag enables detection of all I/O devices (even the uncommon ones)
00671    * and bridges (even those that have no device behind them) using the libpci
00672    * backend.
00673    */
00674   HWLOC_TOPOLOGY_FLAG_WHOLE_IO = (1<<4)
00675 };
00676

00969 enum hwloc_get_type_depth_e {
00970     HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN = -1,    
00971     HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_MULTIPLE = -2,   
00972     HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_BRIDGE = -3,     
00973     HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_PCI_DEVICE = -4, 
00974     HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_OS_DEVICE = -5   
00975 };

00981  hwloc_obj_type_t hwloc_get_depth_type (hwloc_topology_t topology, unsigned depth) ;

00984  unsigned hwloc_get_nbobjs_by_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology, unsigned depth) ;
00985 
00991 static inline int 
00992 hwloc_get_nbobjs_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_obj_type_t type)
00993 {
00994         int depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, type);
00995         if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN)
00996                 return 0;
00997         if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_MULTIPLE)
00998                 return -1; /* FIXME: agregate nbobjs from different levels? */
00999         return hwloc_get_nbobjs_by_depth(topology, depth);
01000 }

01009  int hwloc_topology_is_thissystem(hwloc_topology_t  restrict topology) ;

01020  hwloc_obj_t hwloc_get_obj_by_depth (hwloc_topology_t topology, unsigned depth, unsigned idx) ;
01021 
01028 static inline hwloc_obj_t 
01029 hwloc_get_obj_by_type (hwloc_topology_t topology, hwloc_obj_type_t type, unsigned idx)
01030 {
01031   int depth = hwloc_get_type_depth(topology, type);
01032   if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_UNKNOWN)
01033     return NULL;
01034   if (depth == HWLOC_TYPE_DEPTH_MULTIPLE)
01035     return NULL;
01036   return hwloc_get_obj_by_depth(topology, depth, idx);
01037 }

01122 static inline char * 
01123 hwloc_obj_get_info_by_name(hwloc_obj_t obj, const char *name)
01124 {
01125   unsigned i;
01126   for(i=0; i<obj->infos_count; i++)
01127     if (!strcmp(obj->infos[i].name, name))
01128       return obj->infos[i].value;
01129   return NULL;
01130 }
